weka.distributed.spark

Class WDDataset

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.distributed.spark.AbstractDataset
      • weka.distributed.spark.WDDataset
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class WDDataset
extends AbstractDataset
    Class that encapsulates dataset information - i.e. either an RDD<Instance> along with ARFF header + summary attribute information and/or, a DataFrame.
    Version:
    $Revision: 12253 $
    Author:
    Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • WDDataset

        public WDDataset(org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD<weka.core.Instance> backingRDD,
                 org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset<org.apache.spark.sql.Row> backingDataFrame,
                 weka.core.Instances headerWithSummary)
        Constructor that takes an RDD, a DataFrame and a Instances header. Header can be null (if it has not yet been computed); one, but not both, of the RDD or DataFrame can be null.
        Parameters:
        backingRDD - the backing RDD
        backingDataFrame - the backing DataFrame
        headerWithSummary - the header information for the data

      • materializeRDD

        public void materializeRDD(CachingStrategy strategy,
                           weka.distributed.CSVToARFFHeaderMapTask rowHelper,
                           boolean makeSparseInstances)
                    throws weka.distributed.DistributedWekaException
        Convert the backing DataFrame into an RDD<Instance>. Does not unpersist the DataFrame.
        Parameters:
        strategy - caching strategy to use for persisting the RDD
        rowHelper - optional CSVToARFFHeaderMapTask to use when converting DataFrame rows to Instance objects. Default values for nominal attributes can be specified by supplying a configured CSVToARFFHeaderMapTaks. If not supplied, then a default one is created
        makeSparseInstances - true if the RDD should contain SparseInstance objects rather than DenseInstance ones.
        Throws:
        weka.distributed.DistributedWekaException - if the ARFF header is not set, there is no backing DataFrame to operate on, or the number of columns in the DataFrame does not equal the number of attributes in the ARFF header

      • getAnyDataFrame

        public static org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset<org.apache.spark.sql.Row> getAnyDataFrame(SparkJob job)

      • getAllDataFrames

        public static java.util.List<org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset<org.apache.spark.sql.Row>> getAllDataFrames(SparkJob job)

        public static org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset<org.apache.spark.sql.Row> getDataFrame(SparkJob job,
                                                                                  java.lang.String datasetType)

      • stringRDDToInstanceRDD

        public static org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD<weka.core.Instance> stringRDDToInstanceRDD(SparkJob job,
                                                                                           org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD<java.lang.String> input,
                                                                                           weka.core.Instances headerNoSummary,
                                                                                           java.lang.String csvParseOptions,
                                                                                           boolean enforceMaxPartitions)
        Process an RDD<String> into an RDD<Instance>
        Parameters:
        job - the SparkJob that has produced the input RDD
        input - the RDD<String> input
        headerNoSummary - the header of the data without summary attributes
        csvParseOptions - the options for the CSV parser
        enforceMaxPartitions - if true then any max partitions specified by the user will be enforced (this might trigger a shuffle operation)
        Returns:
        a JavaRDD<Instance> dataset

      • dataFrameToInstanceRDD

        public static org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaRDD<weka.core.Instance> dataFrameToInstanceRDD(CachingStrategy strategy,
                                                                                           org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset<org.apache.spark.sql.Row> frame,
                                                                                           weka.core.Instances header,
                                                                                           weka.distributed.CSVToARFFHeaderMapTask rowHelper,
                                                                                           boolean makeSparseInstances,
                                                                                           boolean unpersistFrame)
                                                                                    throws weka.distributed.DistributedWekaException
        Process a DataFrame into a RDD<Instance>
        Parameters:
        strategy - the CachingStrategy to use for the RDD
        frame - the Dataset<Row> input
        header - the ARFF header to use
        rowHelper - a configured CSVToARFFHeaderMapTask - used for looking up any default nominal values the user may have specified
        makeSparseInstances - true if the Instance objects created should be SparseInstances rather than DenseInstances
        unpersistFrame - true if the input DataFrame should be unpersisted
        Returns:
        a JavaRDD<Instance> dataset
        Throws:
        weka.distributed.DistributedWekaException - if a problem occurs

      • instancesToDataset

        public static WDDataset instancesToDataset(weka.core.Instances toConvert,
                                           org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext context,
                                           int numPartitions)
                                    throws weka.distributed.DistributedWekaException
        Convert a Weka Instances object to a Dataset.
        Parameters:
        toConvert - the Instances to convert
        context - the JavaSparkContext to use
        numPartitions - the number of partitions to create in the Instances RDD encapsulated in the Dataset
        Returns:
        a Dataset
        Throws:
        weka.distributed.DistributedWekaException - if a problem occurs during the conversion
